pandaEditor.ui.document module¶

class pandaEditor.ui.document.Document(file_path, contents)[source]¶

Bases: object

load()[source]¶
on_modified(comps=None)[source]¶

Broadcast the update message and set the dirty flag. Methods subscribed to this message will rebuild ui widgets completely.

on_refresh(comps=None)[source]¶

Broadcast the update message without setting the dirty flag. Methods subscribed to this message will rebuild ui widgets completely.

on_selection_modified(task)[source]¶

Broadcast the update selection message. Methods subscribed to this message should be quick and not force full rebuilds of ui widgets considering how quickly the selection is likely to change.

save(**kwargs)[source]¶
property title¶

OnLeftTreeSelChanged(evt)[source]¶

Select those items in the right list to show the relationship with those the user has selected in the left list.

Set relationship with those items selected in the left list with those the user has selected in the right list.

OnLayout(evt)[source]¶
OnMove(evt)[source]¶

Keep the window’s position on hand before it gets maximized as this is the number we need to save to preferences.

OnShowHidePane(evt)[source]¶

Show or hide the pane based on the menu item that was (un)checked.

OnShowPreferences(evt)[source]¶
OnSize(evt)[source]¶

Keep the window’s size on hand before it gets maximized as this is the number we need to save to preferences.

OnUpdate(comps=None)[source]¶

Change the appearance and states of buttons on the form based on the state of the loaded document.

NOTE: Don’t use freeze / thaw as this will cause the 3D viewport to flicker.

OnUpdateEdit(msg)[source]¶

Update the edit menu. Disable undo or redo queus if they are empty and make sure to refresh the toolbar.

OnUpdateFile(msg)[source]¶

Update the file menu. Disable all menu and toolbar items then turn those back on depending on the document’s state.

OnUpdateModify(msg)[source]¶
OnUpdateProject(msg)[source]¶
OnUpdateView(msg)[source]¶

Update the view menu. Ensure the grid menu item’s checked state matches the visibility of the grid.

OnUpdateWindowMenu(evt)[source]¶

Set the checks in the window menu to match the visibility of the panes.

OnUpdateXform(msg)[source]¶
OnViewCamera(evt, yaw_pitch)[source]¶

Orbit camera top or bottom by manipulating delta values See p3d.camera.Orbit for more

OnViewGrid(evt)[source]¶

Show or hide the grid based on the checked value of the menu item.

class pandaEditor.ui.propertiesPanel.PropertyGrid(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: PropertyGrid

Unfortunately I’ve had to override some of the basic methods of the property grid in order to overcome what seems like an odd limitation / feature. When calling GetProperty() the grid sends back the base class PGProperty, not the actual class that was used when we initially called Append(). This seems odd to me as then none of the overridden methods used in custom properties will work…

drag_drop_validate(x, y, data)[source]¶
on_drop(x, y, data)[source]¶

OnRightDown(evt)[source]¶

This method does nothing. Oddly enough, not binding RightDown seems to affect RightUp’s behaviour, and we only trap half the mouse up events.

pandaEditor.ui.sceneGraphBasePanel module¶

class pandaEditor.ui.sceneGraphBasePanel.SceneGraphBasePanel(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Panel

AddItem(comp, parent_item)[source]¶

Traverse the scene from the root node, creating tree items for each component encountered.

GetDroppedObject(x, y)[source]¶
GetItemsDictionary()[source]¶

Return a dictionary mapping the scene’s components to the item that represents them in the tree.

GetValidSelections()[source]¶

Return a list of selected items, making sure that they are valid by using IsOk() and are not the root item.

OnFlatMenuSelected(evt)[source]¶
OnLeftDClick(evt)[source]¶
OnMiddleDown(evt)[source]¶
OnTreeBeginLabelEdit(evt)[source]¶
OnTreeEndLabelEdit(evt)[source]¶

Change the component’s name to that of the new item’s name.

OnUpdate(comps=None)[source]¶

Update the contents of the TreeCtrl to reflect the contents of the scene. If comps is not None, it will contain only the components which have changed. This means we don’t have to do a full rebuild of the tree which can be time consuming.

Rebuild()[source]¶

Do a complete rebuild of the scene graph.

RefreshItem(comp)[source]¶
RemoveItem(comp, delete=True)[source]¶
SelectItems(items)[source]¶

Iterate over list and hilight them. Make sure the TreeCtrl is open at the last item the user selected.

SetExpandedState(oldItems, newItems)[source]¶

Set item expanded states back.

UpdateItemData(item)[source]¶
